content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Check the Apple Store for the availability of the latest iPhone model and schedule an in-store pickup at the nearest Apple Store for January 10, 2024.  Please interact with https://www.apple.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The latest iPhone model (iPhone 17 Pro) is featured on the main page. To check its availability and schedule an in-store pickup, I should navigate to the iPhone section of the Apple Store.
Action: Click [6]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The latest iPhone model, iPhone 17 Pro, is available for pre-order. To check availability and schedule an in-store pickup, I need to select the iPhone 17 Pro model.
Action: Click [17]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am now on the iPhone 17 Pro landing page. To proceed, I need to look for shopping or pre-order options where I can check availability and select in-store pickup for January 10, 2024. I may need to scroll down to find these options.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.25
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Pre-order" button for the iPhone 17 Pro is visible. To check its availability and proceed to scheduling an in-store pickup, I need to click the "Pre-order" button.
Action: Click [0]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The pre-order section for the iPhone 17 Pro is visible, but I need to select the model and move toward checkout to schedule an in-store pickup. The model selection option is partially visible at the bottom, so I should scroll down to proceed.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The iPhone 17 Pro model is visible, and "Pick up from Store" is one of the options at the top. I need to continue with the configuration (selecting the model, then color, and moving forward to select in-store pickup and date). Scrolling down will likely reveal options for storage, carrier, and pickup or delivery.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The storage selection options (256GB, 512GB, 1TB, 2TB) for iPhone 17 Pro are visible. I need to choose a storage capacity to proceed with the configuration and move toward in-store pickup scheduling.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The storage selection screen is still present, and specific storage options are visible but not labeled with clickable tags. The view may need to be scrolled down further to continue the configuration process toward scheduling the pickup. 
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.96
Completion: 0.62
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Apple Trade In section is now visible, indicating progress in the configuration process. There appears to be an option to select whether or not to participate in the trade-in program, which is a required step before scheduling in-store pickup. I should select "No trade-in" to proceed quickly to the next step.
Action: Click [2]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Apple Trade In options are visible, and I need to choose "No trade-in" to proceed with the purchase flow and get to the in-store pickup scheduling.
Action: Click [2]
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The view has not changed—I'm still seeing the trade-in section, and it seems that the options are not interactive in this view, or further scrolling down is needed for more options. There is no visible progress toward scheduling in-store pickup from this section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The payment options and carrier selection sections are now visible. To proceed with scheduling in-store pickup, I need to select a payment option (such as "Buy") and then choose a carrier.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screen still displays the payment and carrier selection options, and no new selections have been made. To continue with the process, scrolling down may reveal a "Continue" or "Next" button, or more steps to complete the purchase and select in-store pickup.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.82
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The AppleCare coverage options are now visible (AppleCare+ with Theft and Loss, AppleCare One, and No AppleCare coverage). Selecting an option is necessary to proceed to the next step, which should lead to pickup details.
Action: Click [3]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screen still shows the AppleCare coverage choices without indication that a selection has yet been made or registered. Selecting "No AppleCare coverage" will allow us to proceed towards the next step, likely getting to the pickup scheduling.
Action: Click [3]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The AppleCare options are still displayed and it seems no further progress has been made. Since clicking might not be registering, it's possible the screen requires scrolling down for a continue or next step button.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Continue" button is now visible, indicating the next step in the purchase process. Clicking it should move me closer to scheduling the in-store pickup for the iPhone 17 Pro.
Action: Click [1]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.9

Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: "iPhone 17 Pro";	[1]: <button> "";
